DOC.detailed_description: Mexico 's malnutrition problem go beyond lack food . Nutrition transition country modify dietary pattern way observe decrease consumption micronutrient rich food , like vegetable , increase consumption high energy-dense food low content micronutrient ( highly process food ) . In Mexico , 70 % population present inadequate vegetable intake , high prevalence scholar ( 5 - 11 year ) , 17 % consume > 50 % recommend vegetable intake . A vegetable poor diet related malnutrition , poor cognitive development low physical performance . Added , Mexican family lose tradition cooking home . It well know different factor contribute population 's diet cooking home well eat family identify fundamental factor promote healthy diet . Therefore , aim psychoeducational intervention nutrition improve nutritional status family , particularly mother caregiver child age 5 13 year child provide healthy cooking lesson community optimal preparation use local food base vegetable promote time importance cook home eat family highlight .
